post.body:
The amount of people in their early and mid twenties who use tiktok and act like edgy emotional 16 year olds is seriously depressing. Whats worse is that this behavior is most concentrated in academia and others supposed places of "enlightenment" because modern academia attracts lots of emotionally stunted people afraid of "adulting" without a nanny system to insulate them. 

When I was surrounded by social media and internet game obsessive people, I always coped by telling myself I’d find more mature and well-rounded people in college/gradschool/career, but it seems like the window for acting like an adult child is stretching wider and wider. No matter how much I advance, I am surrounded by social degeneracy. It’s tiresome.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
Politics at its most basic definition is simply the way we relate to our neighbors. So is religion. It's the way we love god and our neighbors as ourselves. 

Now, you can say that mainstream politics is corrupt, and so being a part of that politics is un-Christian. But that's not all 'politics,' and you can't simply ban discussing how we relate to our neighbors in Christianity, lol.

body:
Nope, I was an only child, both parents still married, and they raised me the typical way you raise a boy. This was not their doing. And oddly enough this doesn't run in my family either.

I think whatever part of my brain controls reproductive desire is either missing or severely underdeveloped. This is probably a side effect of ASD. All my life I never understood why so many boys were obsessed with getting hurt and beating each other up, and winning at boring af sports. It hurt and it wasn't any fun. And I didn't get what was so bad about being made fun of for having introverted hobbies or stepping outside of the extremely narrow male archetype.

And only recently did I find out why: *because that's how they impress girls*, another thing I was never concerned about. Consciously or not, males are driven to compete and act alpha because it increases their chances of winning a female to have sex with. This alone explains 99% of the social expectations and biological urges for men, because they are the ones who have to compete to impress the ladies and not the other way around. I also found out that men are supposed to have an instinctual desire to physically pass a copy of their genes to another generation, which just sounds silly to me. This is the only reason men are okay with nature and society making their lives suck so much, because they get off to it.

But don’t claim to cite a number by picking your own and saying “well it’s close enough”.

This isn’t complicated. My god.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
I know it's a slippery slope, but such is life. You have some fair concerns, but they aren't fixed by simply shutting down discourse. Generally, open discourse is better than shutting it down.

The decision of Christians to leave slavery in Babylon and Egypt and strike out into the wilderness was a *political* decision. The decision for Harad to remove the head of John the Baptist was a *political* decision. The decision of Pilate to crucify Jesus was a *political* decision. In reality, you can't separate these concepts into two separate bins. It can be harmful to do so. 

We should not separate our life into Church and secular. It is one life. Our Christian lessons are meant for the marketplace.
parent.body_html:
I know it's a slippery slope, but such is life. You have some fair concerns, but they aren't fixed by simply shutting down discourse. Generally, open discourse is better than shutting it down.

The decision of Christians to leave slavery in Babylon and Egypt and strike out into the wilderness was a political decision. The decision for Harad to remove the head of John the Baptist was a political decision. The decision of Pilate to crucify Jesus was a political decision. In reality, you can't separate these concepts into two separate bins. It can be harmful to do so.

We should not separate our life into Church and secular. It is one life. Our Christian lessons are meant for the marketplace.

post.meta_description: As religious faith has declined, ideological intensity has risen. Will the quest for secular redemption through politics doom the American idea?
post.meta_title: How Politics Replaced Religion in America - The Atlantic
post.title: How Politics Replaced Religion in America - The Atlantic

body:
> Why don't women save sex for the men who treat them right? Or are they okay being used like masturbatory objects?

Men are just as guilty of wanting to use women as masturbatory objects as women are wanting to be used that way. The difference is that women get to be the selective ones because they don't psychologically *need* a partner the same way men do, so it's not a big deal if their choosiness ends up leaving them single. But men usually have to settle for less than their ideal.

> I can't stop being an incel without sex, so just fuck me and then I will no longer be an evil incel.

Well that'd be pretty gay, but in any case you say you need sexual release, but you don't need someone to fuck you for that. I am aware of most mens' psychological desire to treat a woman and reproduce, but that is not sex in itself and getting women to let men fuck them on demand is not going to solve that problem either. Sex is more of a physical desire, or rather tension in men.
